alert.note: Alert for Catron; Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Socorro. In west central New Mexico, Catron. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Datil. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 70 and 83. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Remember, ditches are deadly. A gentle flow of water can become a raging torrent in a few minutes.
